metadata.Title: CVE-2016-0752 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Directory traversal vulnerability in Action View in Ruby on Rails before 3.2.22.1, 4.0.x and 4.1.x before 4.1.14.1, 4.2.x before 4.2.5.1, and 5.x before 5.0.0.beta1.1 allows remote attackers to read arbitrary files by leveraging an application's unrestricted use of the render method and providing a .. (dot dot) in a pathname.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-0752` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

rails - 2:4.2.5.1-1
ruby-actionmailer - 2:4.2.5.1-1
ruby-actionpack - 2:4.2.5.1-1
ruby-actionview - 2:4.2.5.1-1
ruby-activejob - 2:4.2.5.1-1
ruby-activemodel - 2:4.2.5.1-1
ruby-activerecord - 2:4.2.5.1-1
ruby-activesupport - 2:4.2.5.1-1
ruby-rails - 2:4.2.5.1-1
ruby-railties - 2:4.2.5.1-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: seth-arnold> In Oneiric-Saucy, rails package is just for transition; The rails package contains actual code from vivid onward

criterions.comment: rails package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:4.2.5.1-1').
